sen.j: 京極 高供（きょうごく たかとも、元和 (日本)9年1月24日 (旧暦)（1623年2月23日） - 延宝2年2月28日 (旧暦)（1674年4月4日））は、丹後国峰山藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Takatomo KYOGOKU (February 23, 1623 - April 4, 1674) was the second feudal lord of Mineyama District, Tango Province.
Takatomo KYOGOKU (February 23, 1623 - April 4, 1674) was the second feudal lord of Mineyama District, Tango Province.
Takatomo KYOGOKU (February 23, 1623 - April 4, 1674) was the second feudal lord of Mineyama Domain, Tango Province.

sen.j: 初代藩主・京極高通 (丹後国峰山藩主)の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of Takamichi KYOGOKU who was the first feudal lord of Mineyama District, Tango Province.
He was the first son of Takamichi KYOGOKU who was the first feudal lord of Mineyama District, Tango Province.
He was the first son of Takamichi KYOGOKU who was the first feudal lord of Mineyama Domain, Tango Province.
His mother was a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU.
His mother was a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU.
His mother was a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU.
His legal wife was a daughter of Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA.
His legal wife was a daughter of Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA.
His legal wife was a daughter of Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA.
His first son was Takaaki KYOGOKU.
His first son was Takaaki KYOGOKU.
His first son was Takaaki KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、主膳正。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was Shuzen no kami.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was Shuzen no kami.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was Shuzen no kami.

sen.j: 元和9年（1623年）正月24日、江戸で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Edo (old name of Tokyo) on January 24, 1623.
He was born in Edo (old name of Tokyo) on January 24, 1623.
He was born in Edo (old name of Tokyo) on February 12, 1623.

sen.j: 寛文5年（1665年）、父が近江国水口城の在番中に死去したため、その後を受けて在番を努めた。
sen.e: In 1665, his father died during he was in service at the Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province, thus Takatomo took over as zaiban.
In 1665, his father died during he was in service at the Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province, thus Takatomo took over as zaiban.
In 1665, his father died during he was in service at the Minakuchi-jo Castle in Omi Province, thus Takatomo took over as zaiban.

sen.j: 家督は寛文6年（1666年）6月14日に継いでいる。
sen.e: He took over as head of the family on June 14, 1666.
sen.cmt: 「家督を継ぐ (take over as head of the family)」という表現があるので、そちらを採用しました。
sen.e: He took over as head of the family on June 14, 1666.
He took over as head of the family on July 15, 1666.

sen.j: このとき、弟の京極高昌に武蔵国・近江国内において1000石、京極高成に500石ほどを分与している。
sen.e: At that time, he divided the domain of Musashi Province and Omi Province for his younger brothers: 1,000 koku for Takamasa KYOGOKU and 500 koku for Takanari KYOGOKU.
At that time, he divided the domain of Musashi Province and Omi Province for his younger brothers: 1,000 koku for Takamasa KYOGOKU and 500 koku for Takanari KYOGOKU.
At that time, he divided the domain of Musashi Province and Omi Province for his younger brothers: 1,000 koku for Takamasa KYOGOKU and 500 koku for Takanari KYOGOKU.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: その後も水口在番を努め、延宝2年（1674年）2月28日、江戸で死去した。
sen.e: After that he kept serving as Mizuguchi zaiban and died in Edo on February 28, 1674.
After that he kept serving as Mizuguchi zaiban and died in Edo on February 28, 1674.
After that he kept serving as Mizuguchi zaiban and died in Edo on April 4, 1674.
His age at death was 52.
His age at death was 52.
His age at death was 52.

sen.j: 後を長男・高明が継いだ。
sen.e: His first son, Takaaki took over the position.
His first son, Takaaki took over the position.
His first son, Takaaki took over the position.

sen.j: 法号：常立院然誉春山道栄。
sen.e: His hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Joryuinnenyoshunzandoei (常立院然誉春山道栄).
sen.cmt: 常立院然誉春山道栄→Joryuinnenyoshunzandoei[定訳不明]
sen.e: His hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Joryuinnenyoshunzandoei (常立院然誉春山道栄).
His hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Joryuinnenyoshunzandoei (常立院然誉春山道栄).
